THE KENYA NATIONAL EXAMINATIONS COUNCIL

\title{
DIPLOMA IN INFORMIATION COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY MODULE 1
}

\section*{COMPUTATIONAL MATHEMATICS}

3 hours

\section*{INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES}

This paper consists of EIGHT questions. Answer any FIVE questions in the answer booklet provided. Candidates should answer the questions in English.)

This paper consists of 5 printed pages.
Candidates should check the question paper to ascertain that all the pages are printed as indicated and that mo questions are missing.
![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/cropped/2025_03_30_206fbdbf717d2ef3f151g-2.jpg?height=2708&width=2036&top_left_y=42&top_left_x=12)
(b) Rama, Shem and Mogan purchased cookies of different brands P, Q and R. Rama purchased 10 packets of $P, 7$ packets of $Q$ and 3 packets of $R$. Shem purchased 4 packets of $P, 8$ packets of $Q$ and 10 packets of R. Mogan purchased 4 packets of $P, 7$ packets of $Q$ and 8 packets of R. The cost of each brand is Kshs 40,50 and 60 respectively.
(i) Represent the information in matrices notation
(ii) Use the matrix method to determine the amount of money spent by each person.
(2 marks)
(c) Use the cofactor method to determine the inverse of matrix $\mathrm{D}=\left[\begin{array}{lll}3 & 1 & 6 \\ 2 & 0 & 4 \\ 5 & 7 & 2\end{array}\right]$.
(a) (i) Outline three features of symbolic model.
(ii) A certain shop has all their commodities on sale with a $15 \%$ discount offer.
(I) Formulate a mathematical model that could be used to determine the sale price of each commodity in the shop.
(II) Using the model formulated in (I).determine the sale price of a commodity whose original price is Ksh 500.
(b) The following statements describes various operations:
(i) Picking a team of 3 student leaders' from a group of 10 students;
(ii) Picking a chairman, secretary and freasurer from a group of 10 students;
(iii) Choosing 3 desserts from a menu of 10 ;
(iv) Listing your 3 favourite desserts, in order, from a menu of 10 ;

State whether each of the statement requires a permutation or a combination operation.
(c) A 4-digit PIN (4 marks)

PIN is divisible by 10 and the formed using the digits $0,3,5,7,8$ and 9 such that the that would be formed.
(d) Distinguish between absolute error and relative error as used in measurement.
(a) (i) State the meaning of the following terms as used in logical mathematical statements:
(I) Tautology;
(II) Contradiction.
(ii) Use a truth table to determine whether each of the following is either a tautology
or contradiction:
(I) $\quad A \wedge(-(A \vee B))$;
(II) $\quad \mathrm{P} \vee(\mathrm{P} \leftrightarrow \mathrm{Q}) \vee \mathrm{Q}$.
(b) A pupil in nursery school was asked to paint each section of the following shape using 8 crayons of different colours.
![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/cropped/2025_03_30_206fbdbf717d2ef3f151g-4.jpg?height=440&width=1198&top_left_y=170&top_left_x=448)

Determine the total number of ways of painting the shape.
(4 marks)
(c) With the aid of a truth table, describe each of the following gates as applied in electronics.
(i) AND - series of logit gates with 2 or more switd
(ii) OR - parallel logic gates with 2 or more swith
(iii) NOT
(8 marks)
6. (a) Outline three characteristics of each of the following types of skewness:
(i) positive skewness;
(ii) negative skewness.
(b) Explain three differences between absolute measures and relative measures as used in statistics.
(c) Use truth tables to prove the following digital algebraic equation:
$$\overline{A B}=\bar{A}+\bar{B}$$
(d) Use the graphical method to solve the quadratic equation:
$$\begin{array}{ll}
3 x^{2}+5 x-2=0 & 3 x^{2}+5 x-2=0 \\
& 3 x(x+0)+5(x-2)
\end{array}$$
7. (a) (i) Outline two limitations of using charts to represent statistical data. (2 marks)
(ii) Table 1 shows the frequency distribution of packets of milk produced by a farm
$$\begin{array}{ll}
x & F \\
\operatorname{san} 10490
\end{array}$$
$$\text { April } 7+9,6$$
may 4815 for a period of six months. Use it to answer the question that follows.
$$\text { Feb } 12325$$
$$\text { march } 10201$$

Jun (b) 36\$
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|l|l|}
\hline Month & Jan & Feb & march \\
\hline Frequency & 10490 & 12325 & 10201 \\
Table 1 \\
Represent the information using a histogram
\end{tabular}
(b) 36 A polynomial function is given by $f(x)=x^{2}-4 x-7=0$. Using the Newton Raphson iterative method, determine the root of the equation rounded off to 4 decimal places. Take the initial root $x_{0}=5$.
![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/cropped/2025_03_30_206fbdbf717d2ef3f151g-4.jpg?height=343&width=1228&top_left_y=2398&top_left_x=481)
(6 marks)
(c) The radius of a sphere was measured and found to be 20 cm with a possible error in measurement of 0.01 cm .
(i) Determine the maximum error in the computation of volume using this value of the radius.
(ii) Determine the relative error in each of the following measures:
(I) Radius;
(II) Volume.
8. (a) State the meaning of each of the following terms as used in probability:
(i) random experiment;
(ii) sample space;
(iii) outcome;
(iv) sample point.
(b) Distinguish between discreet random variable and continuous random variable as used in probability.
(c) Distinguish between odd and even parity as applied in digital communications.
(d) Use the algebraic iterative formula $x_{n+1}=\sqrt[3]{20-5 x_{n}}$ to determine the solution of the equation $x^{3}+5 x=20$ given the initial value $X_{0}=2$. Give your answer
to 3 decimal places.
